description: System, JVM, Pipeline and individual plugin stats

panels.description:
What it shows: Availability status of Logstash instances matching the selected instance filter

Why it matters: Critical for monitoring data pipeline health - Logstash downtime disrupts log processing and data ingestion flows

Action: Alert immediately on any DOWN values; investigate service health, configuration issues, or infrastructure problems affecting Logstash instances
panels.title: System UP / DOWN

panels.description:
What it shows: Percentage of events that are queued/lagging in the selected Logstash pipeline (difference between events in and events out)

Why it matters: High lag indicates pipeline processing bottlenecks or insufficient throughput capacity causing event backlog

Action: Monitor for sustained increases; investigate pipeline performance, resource constraints, or output destination issues causing processing delays
panels.title: Pipeline Event Lag

panels.description:
What it shows: Total number of bulk requests with errors from output plugins in the selected Logstash pipeline and instance

Why it matters: Output errors indicate failed data delivery to destinations like Elasticsearch - can result in data loss or processing delays

Action: Investigate any non-zero values; check destination connectivity, authentication, mapping issues, or resource constraints on target systems
panels.title: Ingestion Failures (Out of 100)

panels.description:
What it shows: Total virtual memory allocated to the Logstash process in bytes for the selected instance

Why it matters: Tracks memory allocation patterns - excessive virtual memory usage may indicate memory leaks or inefficient pipeline configurations

Action: Monitor growth trends; investigate if continuously increasing as it may indicate memory management issues requiring pipeline optimization
panels.title: Logstash ps total vmem

panels.description:
What it shows: Maximum number of file descriptors available to the Logstash process on the selected instance

Why it matters: Defines the limit for concurrent file handles, network connections, and other resources - insufficient limits can cause connection failures

Action: Ensure adequate for expected workload; increase system limits if approaching maximum during peak operations to prevent resource exhaustion
panels.title: Logstash ps fds

panels.description:
What it shows: Maximum configured queue size in bytes for the selected Logstash pipeline and instance

Why it matters: Defines the buffer capacity for events - helps understand pipeline capacity limits and memory allocation for queuing

Action: Ensure adequate for expected event volumes; adjust queue size if pipeline frequently hits capacity limits causing backpressure
panels.title: Pipeline Max Queue Size

panels.description:
What it shows: Current queue size in bytes for events waiting to be processed in the selected Logstash pipeline and instance

Why it matters: Indicates pipeline backlog and processing efficiency - high queue usage suggests processing bottlenecks or insufficient throughput

Action: Monitor against maximum queue size; investigate if consistently high as it may indicate need for pipeline optimization or scaling
panels.title: Pipeline Max Queue Size

panels.description:
What it shows: Amount of memory committed to the JVM old generation heap space in bytes for the selected Logstash instance

Why it matters: Old generation holds long-lived objects - high committed memory indicates heap allocation patterns and potential memory pressure

Action: Monitor alongside old generation usage; investigate if growing continuously as it may indicate memory leaks or need for heap tuning
panels.title: Old pool usage

panels.description:
What it shows: Amount of memory committed to the JVM young generation heap space in bytes for the selected Logstash instance

Why it matters: Young generation handles short-lived objects and frequent allocations - affects garbage collection frequency and performance

Action: Monitor alongside GC metrics; optimize pipeline configurations if young generation pressure is causing frequent garbage collections
panels.title: Young pool usage

panels.description:
What it shows: Amount of memory committed to the JVM survivor space in bytes for the selected Logstash instance

Why it matters: Survivor space holds objects that survived initial garbage collection - affects memory allocation efficiency and GC performance

Action: Monitor as part of overall heap health; investigate if disproportionately large compared to young generation allocation patterns
panels.title: Survivor pool usage

panels.description:
What it shows: Total number of old generation garbage collection events for the selected Logstash instance over the selected time range

Why it matters: Old generation GC events are expensive and can cause processing pauses - frequent collections indicate memory pressure

Action: Investigate if count is high; may indicate memory leaks, insufficient heap size, or need for JVM tuning to reduce GC frequency
panels.title: Old Colletions Count

panels.description:
What it shows: Average time spent per old generation garbage collection event in milliseconds for the selected Logstash instance

Why it matters: Long GC pauses indicate memory pressure and can cause significant processing delays affecting pipeline throughput

Action: Investigate if average duration exceeds acceptable thresholds; optimize heap settings or reduce memory pressure
panels.title: Average time spent for GC (yound & old gens in ms)

panels.description:
What it shows: Current number of active threads in the Logstash JVM process for the selected instance

Why it matters: Thread count indicates processing concurrency and resource usage - excessive threads can cause context switching overhead

Action: Monitor for unexpected increases; investigate if thread count grows continuously as it may indicate thread leaks or configuration issues
panels.title: Threads count

panels.description:
What it shows: Total number of young generation garbage collection events for the selected Logstash instance over the selected time range

Why it matters: Young generation GC is normal but excessive frequency can impact performance - indicates object allocation patterns

Action: Monitor trends; investigate if dramatically increasing as it may suggest memory allocation issues or need for heap optimization
panels.title: Young Colletions Count

panels.description:
What it shows: Percentage of JVM heap memory currently being used for the selected Logstash instance

Why it matters: High heap usage indicates memory pressure and can lead to frequent garbage collections affecting pipeline performance

Action: Alert if consistently above 80%; investigate memory usage patterns and consider increasing heap size or optimizing pipeline configurations
panels.title: JVM Heap % used

panels.description:
What it shows: Maximum heap memory allocated to the Logstash JVM process in bytes for the selected instance

Why it matters: Defines the memory ceiling for Logstash operations - critical for capacity planning and performance tuning

Action: Ensure adequate for expected workload; typically set based on available system memory and processing requirements
panels.title: JVM Heap usage

panels.description:
What it shows: Rate of events entering the selected Logstash pipeline per second for the selected instance

Why it matters: Indicates incoming data volume and pipeline load - helps assess processing capacity and identify traffic patterns

Action: Monitor for spikes that may overwhelm pipeline capacity; compare with output rates to identify processing bottlenecks
panels.title: Pipeline Event In

panels.description:
What it shows: Rate of events exiting the selected Logstash pipeline per second for the selected instance

Why it matters: Indicates pipeline throughput and processing efficiency - should match input rate in healthy pipelines

Action: Compare with input rate to identify processing delays; investigate if consistently lower than input as it indicates pipeline bottlenecks
panels.title: Pipeline Event Out

panels.description:
What it shows: Rate of events being filtered (processed by filter plugins) per second in the selected Logstash pipeline for the selected instance

Why it matters: Indicates filter processing activity and complexity - high rates may suggest intensive data transformation or parsing operations

Action: Monitor for performance impact; investigate if filter processing becomes a bottleneck affecting overall pipeline throughput
panels.title: Pipeline Event Filtered

panels.description:
What it shows: Rate of cumulative time spent processing events (in milliseconds per second) for the selected Logstash pipeline and instance

Why it matters: Indicates processing intensity and efficiency - high values suggest complex operations or performance bottlenecks in the pipeline

Action: Monitor for increases that correlate with performance issues; investigate pipeline configurations causing excessive processing time
panels.title: Pipeline Event Duration

panels.description:
What it shows: Rate of cumulative time spent pushing events to the pipeline queue (in milliseconds per second) for the selected pipeline and instance

Why it matters: High values indicate queue contention or backpressure - suggests the pipeline is struggling to keep up with incoming events

Action: Monitor for spikes that indicate queue bottlenecks; investigate pipeline capacity or consider increasing queue size or worker threads
panels.title: Pipeline Queue Push Duration

panels.description:
What it shows: Total number of events that have entered filter plugins in the Logstash pipeline

Why it matters: Tracks filter processing volume and helps identify which filters are handling the most events for performance analysis

Action: Monitor for unexpected patterns; compare across different filter plugins to identify processing hotspots or bottlenecks
panels.title: Pipeline Filters Event In

panels.description:
What it shows: Total number of events that have exited filter plugins in the Logstash pipeline

Why it matters: Tracks filter processing completion and helps identify event transformation efficiency across different filter plugins

Action: Compare with events in to identify filters that drop or duplicate events; investigate discrepancies that may indicate processing issues
panels.title: Pipeline Filters Event Out

panels.description:
What it shows: Total time spent processing events in filter plugins (in milliseconds) across the Logstash pipeline

Why it matters: Identifies slow filter operations that may be bottlenecks - helps optimize pipeline performance by targeting expensive filters

Action: Monitor for filters with disproportionately high processing times; optimize or replace slow filters to improve overall pipeline throughput
panels.title: Pipeline Filters Event Duration

panels.description:
What it shows: Total number of successful matches or pattern hits in filter plugins across the Logstash pipeline

Why it matters: Indicates filter effectiveness and pattern matching success rates - helps assess filter configuration accuracy

Action: Monitor match rates to validate filter patterns are working correctly; investigate low match rates that may indicate misconfigured filters
panels.title: Pipeline Filteres matches

panels.description:
What it shows: Total number of failures or errors that occurred in filter plugins across the Logstash pipeline

Why it matters: Filter failures can cause data loss or processing errors - indicates configuration issues or data format problems

Action: Investigate any non-zero values immediately; check filter configurations, input data formats, and error logs to resolve processing failures
panels.title: Pipeline Filteres failures

panels.description:
What it shows: Total number of events successfully sent by output plugins in the Logstash pipeline

Why it matters: Indicates successful data delivery to destinations - critical for monitoring pipeline completion and data integrity

Action: Compare with pipeline events out to verify all events reach their destinations; investigate discrepancies that may indicate output failures
panels.title: Pipeline Output Event Out

panels.description:
What it shows: Total number of events received by output plugins in the Logstash pipeline

Why it matters: Tracks events reaching the output stage - helps verify pipeline flow and identify potential bottlenecks before final delivery

Action: Compare with events out from output plugins to identify delivery failures; should match pipeline events out in healthy configurations
panels.title: Pipeline Output Events In

panels.description:
What it shows: Total time spent processing events in output plugins (in milliseconds) across the Logstash pipeline

Why it matters: Identifies slow output operations that may bottleneck the entire pipeline - critical for optimizing data delivery performance

Action: Monitor for outputs with high processing times; optimize slow destinations, increase batch sizes, or add parallelism to improve throughput
panels.title: Pipeline Output Event Duration

panels.description:
What it shows: Percentage of successful and failed bulk requests from output plugins in the selected Logstash pipeline and instance

Why it matters: Critical for monitoring data delivery reliability - high failure rates indicate destination issues affecting data integrity

Action: Alert on failure rate increases; investigate destination connectivity, authentication, or capacity issues when success rate drops below acceptable thresholds
panels.title: Ingestion Stats

panels.description:
What it shows: Rate of successful bulk requests per second from output plugins in the selected Logstash pipeline and instance

Why it matters: Indicates successful data delivery throughput to destinations - key metric for monitoring pipeline output performance

Action: Monitor trends to understand delivery capacity; investigate drops that may indicate destination performance issues or connectivity problems
panels.title: Pipeline Ingestion Success

panels.description:
What it shows: Rate of failed bulk requests per second from output plugins in the selected Logstash pipeline and instance

Why it matters: Failed requests indicate data delivery problems that can result in data loss or processing delays

Action: Alert on any non-zero values; investigate destination issues, authentication failures, or capacity constraints causing bulk request errors
panels.title: Pipeline Ingestion Errors

title: Logstash Dashboard
